sub_topic: Probability of winning a game of chance
message_1: A lottery game consists of drawing three numbers from 1 to 10 without replacement. What is the probability of winning the game if you purchase one ticket?
message_2:
To find the probability of winning the game with one ticket, we need to determine the total number of possible outcomes and the number of successful outcomes.

There are 10 numbers to choose from, and we are drawing 3 numbers without replacement. So, the total number of possible outcomes can be calculated using combinations:

C(n, r) = n! / (r!(n-r)!)

where n is the total number of items, r is the number of items to choose, and ! denotes the factorial.

In this case, n = 10 and r = 3:

C(10, 3) = 10! / (3!(10-3)!)
C(10, 3) = 10! / (3!7!)
C(10, 3) = (10 × 9 × 8 × 7!)/(3 × 2 × 1 × 7!)
C(10, 3) = (10 × 9 × 8)/(3 × 2 × 1)
C(10, 3) = 720 / 6
C(10, 3) = 120

So, there are 120 possible outcomes when drawing 3 numbers from 1 to 10 without replacement.

Since you are purchasing only one ticket, there is only one successful outcome (matching all three numbers). Therefore, the probability of winning the game with one ticket is:

P(winning) = (number of successful outcomes) / (total number of possible outcomes)
P(winning) = 1 / 120

The probability of winning the game with one ticket is 1/120 or approximately 0.0083 (0.83%).
